attachments.displayName:
There is a veil in our hearts which is shutting out the light and hiding the face of God from us.  Our fleshly fallen nature living on, un-judged within us.  It is the self-life which we have been secretly ashamed and have never brought to the judgment of the cross.  This veil will block our spiritual progress with God.

What is this veil?  Self sins.  self-righteousness, self-pity, self-confidence, self-sufficiency, self-admiration, self-love, egotism, exhibitionism, self-promotion.  Promoting self under the guise of promoting Christ is currently so common as to excite little notice.

This veil can be removed only by God.  Our part is to yield and trust.  We must insist upon the work being done.  It is not pleasant, and will be painful. Just as Christ suffered on His cross we too must suffer on ours.  A spiritual suffering. Like giving birth the pain is quickly forgotten and we will have entered into a new spiritual experience in the Presence of the Living God!
~THE PURSUIT OF GOD BY A.W. TOZER
